title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 302.13 - Stalled, disabled and unattended vehicles
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 302.13 - Stalled, disabled and unattended vehicles

State Regulations

Motor vehicles which are stalled or disabled so that they are
unable to move by their own power and non-self propelled vehicles which are
disabled so that they cannot be towed by the animal or motor vehicle with which
they are normally combined, may be removed by the authority and parked
elsewhere on authority property, or parked, garaged, or stored elsewhere at the
risk and expense of the owner. Vehicles left unattended may be parked, garaged, or stored at the risk and expense of the owner, except that vehicles may be
parked in such places as may be designated by the authority as parking areas
for periods not in excess of 48 hours. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
302.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
